result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tariq J Newson

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Cases 21CF312, 21CF440, 21CF460, 21CF461, 21CF462, 21CF647, 21CM375, 22CF189, 22CF190, 22CF418 called at 10:05am
Defendant Tariq J Newson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Tariq J Newson.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sonya Newson, Defendant's mother appears via telephone. 

Parties verify receipt and review of newest report from Dr. Schoenecker, not contesting findings. 

Atty Luchsinger requests of the Court direct 'someone' come in and provide services for Mr. Newson at the jail. 

Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty Luchsinger believes Mr. Newson remains 84th on the list for Mendota.

Atty Luchsinger gives bond argument; statement made by Mr. Newson's mother. 
ADA Parson objects to bond modification. 

The Court denies motion for bond modification; gives basis.

The Court indicates that it has already ordered once a bed is available, Mr. Newson is to be immediately transferred. 

The Court orders another report is to be filed prior to next court date, the Court clarifies that this is simply the normal follow up report during competency proceedings. 

The Court alerts parties that due to judicial rotation, this case will likely be assigned to Branch 4. 
recess: 10:23am 
NEXT: Review on 1/9/23 at 10:00am (Review of Competency)
Review hearing on October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order for Commitment for Treatment

ec: DA, Atty Luchsinger, DHS/MMHI (7/6/22--ma)

[MK] cases #21CF312, #21CF440, #21CF460, #21CF461, #21CF462, #21CF647, #21CM375, #22CF189, #22CF190 called at 3:20pm 
Defendant Tariq J Newson in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven Luchsinger.  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Parson verifies victim rights compliance. 
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense has no objection to the finding of Dr. Marcus. Attorney Luchsinger confirms that he has discussed with Mr. Newson that he has the opportunity to have evidence presented as to his competency.  Mr. Newson verifies that he understands this, and he is not contesting the finding that he is currently incompetent. 

The Court finds that Mr. Newson is not competent to proceed at this time, though he is likely to regain competency within the statutory period with treatment. The Court does not find that there is a basis for involuntary administration of medications. 
The Court suspends the proceedings. The Court commits Mr. Newson to the Department of Health Services; the Department shall determine whether treatment is to be inpatient or outpatient.
As to days credit for time served in the cases, the Court directs counsel to liaison and then set forth the days credit in the proposed commitment orders. 

Arguments are presented on the Defense request for modification of bond to signature bonds with Scram-monitoring provisions. 
The Court denies the bond modification-request. The Cash Bond and conditions remain as fixed.  
recess 3:31pm.  

NEXT:  (1) Attorney Luchsinger is to submit proposed orders of commitment, (2) Review Hearing (re competency status) on October 4th at 10:00am

Order for Competency Examination

ec: DA, Atty Luchsinger, DHS/MMHI(5/27/22--ma)
Competency hearing on July 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Cases 22CF189 and 22CF190 called at 8:41AM
Court Reporter Kathy Redlin.
Defendant Tariq J Newson in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Luchsinger advises that he has concerns about the Defendant's competency, and requests that the Defendant undergo a competency evaluation. The State does not object.

The Court finds:
The Defendant has been charged with crimes, probable cause has been found, and there is reason to doubt the Defendant's competency to proceed.

The Court orders
1. The Defendant shall submit to an examination of his or her competency to proceed.
2. The examination shall be conducted by the Department of Health Services (DHS), which shall determine
where the examination will be conducted, who will conduct the examination and whether the examination will
be conducted on an outpatient or inpatient basis. Outpatient examination shall be conducted in a jail or a
locked unit of a facility unless the defendant is not in custody.
3. If an inpatient examination is necessary, unless the defendant is not in custody, the sheriff shall:
**Arrange for the transportation of the defendant to the examining facility within 48 hours after
notification. Return the defendant to the jail within 48 hours, after receiving notice from the examining facility that
the examination has been completed.
4. The examiner shall have access to the defendants past or present records, as defined under 51.30(1)(b),
Wis. Stats.
5. The examination shall be completed and a report filed within:
**15 days from the date of admission for an inpatient examination.
**30 days from the date of this order for an outpatient examination.
6. The report shall include a determination on the defendants competency to proceed pursuant to 971.14(3),
Wis. Stats., and the competency of the defendant to refuse medication.
7. A hearing will be held on July 1, 2022 at 3:00PM before court
official Judge Robert F Dehring, or such other time as set by the court.

The Court finds that the examining medical professional may appear by phone for the next hearing. 
The Court instructs Att Luchsinger to draft an Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health 

recess 8:49AM

NEXT: (1) Clerk - Please remove th e06/03 Status Confernece from all of Mr. Newson's files   (2) Competency Hearing on 07/01 at 3:00PM with in person appearances
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF189, 22CF190, 21CF312 called at 1:19 PM [Court Reporter: Rose Roderick]
Defendant Tariq J Newson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Kayla Barteck (the PD will appoint counsel).  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Appearances occur in Cases 22CF189 & 22CF190:
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit *OR* Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel 

As to Case 22CF189, the Court requires a $750  Signature Bond.

As to Case 22CF190, the Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond.
--no presence at Dollar General in Watertown
--maintain absolute sobriety

On State's Motion to Modify Bond in Case 21CF312:
Bond Arguments given by Counsel 

As to Case 21CF312, the Court requires a $2500 CASH bond, with conditions as previously set. 

recess 1:31  pm. 

NEXT: As to Cases 22CF189 & 22CF190, (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/18/22 at 8:30am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 5/26/22 at 8:30am (3)Status on 6/3/22 at 11:00am
